title:
On $Q$-polynomial distance-regular graphs with a linear dependency
  involving a $3$-clique
abstract:
Let $\Gamma$ denote a distance-regular graph with diameter $D \geq 2$. Let
$E$ denote a primitive idempotent of $\Gamma$ with respect to which $\Gamma$ is
$Q$-polynomial. Assume that there exists a $3$-clique $x,y,z$ such that
$E\hat{x},E\hat{y},E\hat{z}$ are linearly dependent. In this paper, we classify
all the $Q$-polynomial distance-regular graphs $\Gamma$ with the above
property. We describe these graphs from multiple points of view.
